Dispute_Type: Interpretation of 'ice clause' in Booking Note
Legal_Issue: Enforceability of foreign arbitration clause under Canadian law
Governing_Law: Marine Liability Act, s. 46; Federal Courts Act, s. 50(1)(b)
Evidence_Assessment: Location of evidence, connections of parties, cost barriers for arbitration in England
Burden_of_Proof: On Comtois to show strong cause for not staying the action
Legal_Rule: Section 46 of the Marine Liability Act does not apply to charter-parties; court may exercise discretion under s. 50(1)(b) of the Federal Courts Act
Standard_of_Review: Whether justice requires a stay of proceedings
Procedural_Issue: Whether arbitration clause mandates resolution in England
Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over additional shipping costs due to ice clause interpretation
Outcome_on_Merits: Action permitted to proceed in Canada
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court considered fairness of requiring Canadian claimant to arbitrate in England
Key_Evidence_Considered: Parties' connections to Canada, location of witnesses and documents, financial burden of English arbitration
Legal_Framework: Canadian federal maritime law, arbitration law
Applicant_Challenge: Livestock Express sought to enforce arbitration clause
Court_Result: Denied stay, allowed case to proceed in Canada
Legal_Rule_Source: Marine Liability Act, Federal Courts Act
Defendant_Response: Argued enforcement of arbitration clause requiring dispute resolution in England
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (Booking Note), jurisdictional facts, cost estimates
Remedy_Requested: Stay of proceedings in favor of arbitration in England
Outcome: Stay denied, costs awarded to Comtois
Remedy_Sought: Proceed with litigation in Canadian courts
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial determination on motion to stay
Legal_Provision: Marine Liability Act, s. 46; Federal Courts Act, s. 50(1)(b)
Legal_Provision_Cited: Marine Liability Act, s. 46; Federal Courts Act, s. 50(1)(b)
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Arbitration clause invalid or inapplicable due to charter-party exclusion
Applicable_Process: Domestic court litigation vs. foreign arbitration
Governing_Rule: Charter-parties excluded from s. 46 protection; discretionary stay under s. 50(1)(b)
